procedure.summary: Mix ketchup, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce together in a small bowl.
procedure.description: Use ¾ cup (176 grams) of ketchup, 2 tbsp (28.7 grams) of fresh lemon juice, and 1 US tbsp (0.50  fl oz) of Worcestershire sauce. This recipe should make around 1 ½ cups (337 grams) of cocktail sauce so don’t choose too large of a bowl. An easy way to get fresh lemon juice is to slice a lemon in half and squeeze the juice into a small dish. If you are squeezing out your own lemon juice, you may opt to use a lemon squeezer, which will also help keep any seeds from getting into the juice. Make sure you remove any lemon seeds before putting the juice into the mixing bowl. You can also buy lemon juice at any local grocery store.

procedure.summary: Grate fresh horseradish and add it to the mixing bowl.
procedure.description: Finely grate the horseradish until you have ⁄2 cup (4.0  fl oz) before adding it to the ketchup. Stir the mixture once or twice to combine the ingredients. You can also use prepared horseradish. In that case, add ⁄3 cup (5.3  fl oz) instead.

procedure.summary: Sprinkle pepper into the mixing bowl and stir the sauce.
procedure.description: Use about ¼ tsp (1.4 grams) of ground black pepper. You don’t need to stir the sauce too much, just enough to mix all of the ingredients together. To add a bit of spice, you can add a dash of hot sauce.

procedure.summary: Chill your sauce for 1 hour before you serve it.
procedure.description: You can keep your sauce in the same bowl you made it in and place it in the refrigerator, uncovered. If you’re in a rush, you can chill your cocktail sauce for a shorter amount of time or not at all, but it may not taste as good.

procedure.summary: Store any leftover cocktail sauce in the refrigerator for up to a month.
procedure.description: Seal your cocktail sauce in an airtight container if you plan to store it. To keep your homemade sauce longer, pop it in the freezer, and it’ll keep up to a year.
